text: hi guys guess what we have this really

with fantastic beautiful delicious

making a recipe from there One Bowl
chocolate cake my favorite chocolate
cake it's delicious it's easy its
variable wait till you try it you're
never gonna make another chocolate cake
again I have three cups of sugar in this
bowl and I'm gonna add three cups of
all-purpose flour to the bowl and you
guess what you can do this all by hand
one and a half cups of Dutch processed
cocoa powder this is a very big recipe
it makes a lot of cupcakes so don't be
overwhelmed can give that a little whisk
then you add a tablespoon of baking soda
one and a half teaspoons of baking
powder and one and a half teaspoons of
salt
that's your dry ingredients then you can
whisk everything together and then add
your wet ingredients one and a half cups
of room-temperature butter milk three
quarters of a cup of a neutral oil like
a canola oil or vegetable oil and then
one and a half cups of warm water gets
whisked into wonderous One Bowl this is
a wondrous recipe and it lasts days and
then three eggs and a teaspoon and a
half of vanilla pure vanilla extract
your batters done voila now you could
just drink this or you could just go

line your cupcake liners these are
standard muffin tins or cupcake tins
it'll make about 36 approximately so
you've got plenty for all your partying
needs fill them about two-thirds full
I'm gonna use an ice cream scoop see how
loose it is the great thing about this
is that it's so liquidy that you can
pour it into your muffin tins makes it
nice and simple put them in a 350 degree
oven for 20 to 25 minutes and they're
done after the cupcakes come out of the
oven take them out of the muffin tins
and let them cool completely on a wire
rack and then
comes the fun part it's the decorating
and I have a really fun tip I'm going to
share with you it's from our cakes and
cupcakes special issue and it's super
duper easy so you're gonna need kind of
a large pastry bag for this or a zip top
bags cut off the tip and then put your
piping tip inside the bag I'm using I
don't know I guess it's about a half
inch round tip all right twist it and
stick it inside it's just a little bit
and that'll just make it so that the
frosting doesn't come out as you're
filling open up your bag fold down the
top this makes it so that it doesn't get
messy on the top and your fans don't get
all covered in frosting and then take
two different colors of frosting or two
different flavors I have vanilla and
chocolate here and then fill the bag but
keep all your white frosting on one side
of the bag like that you're gonna make
stripes it's gonna be cool you'll see
and then turn the bag around and put the
chocolate frosting on the other side use
whatever frosting you like this is a
Swiss meringue buttercream alright it
doesn't look so pretty right now so
don't get freaked out
then unfold the sides of the bag shake
the frosting down into the bag and as
you can see right here it's all nice and
clean so now the icing won't go out the
top gather it together press the
frosting down so that it fills your bags
release your little stopper twist it and
then you can start piping and wait to
see what happens well you've probably
already guessed that it's gonna be
striping as it comes out it's two colors
it's a really fun and really easy way to
embellish your cupcakes and it'll look
